playerText: You are a pair of fish encircling each other. What is that like?
npcText: Quite rude to ask, for starters - and it's only an abstraction. I invite you to press the 'Look' key and see for yourself.

playerText: No, I am fairly certain that you are a pair of fish encircling each other.
npcText: Speak not when you know not, lest your blood slake the soil's thirst. Now speak on more pleasant things.

playerText: You are two fish encircling each other, certain and most true, without lying. Show me.
npcText: If you insist. Now, I banish you from my study. Hover betwixt the archway, if you must. Any more than that, and the glory of my ray will turn your face into a copper powder - and in doing so, marginally improve your visage.

playerText: You have exhausted my goodwill. Now you must be slain.
